tika.dc.description: "Louis Proud's The Secret Influence of the Moon is a fascinating and original book that will forever change the way you view Earth's nearest celestial neighbor."—(Mike Bara, author of Ancient Aliens on the Moon) Despite being the most prominent celestial body after the Sun, the Moon has many qualities that science has yet to explain. Lunar rock samples reveal the Moon once had a magnetic field like the Earth, and seismic experiments by NASA suggest the Moon is at least partially hollow. For centuries people have observed lights, moving clouds and shadows, and even the disappearance of entire craters via telescope. Apollo astronauts repeatedly felt the presence of a "non-human intelligence" during their Moon visits, and many indigenous traditions speak of malevolent visitors from the Moon. A growing body of astrophysical and geological evidence shows the Moon is not an entirely natural world—that someone or something altered it long ago. Louis Proud explores the...
tika.dc.subject: Occult/Spirituality
